alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lauderdale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 8:13PM CDT until March 31 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL LAUDERDALE...SOUTHEASTERN COLBERT AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 813 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Waynesboro to near Russellville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Florence, Muscle Shoals, Russellville, Sheffield, Tuscumbia, Phil Campbell, Killen, Littleville, Leighton and St. Florian. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Alabama. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
